bug.author: sahajre
bug.summary: Plotting demo failed with exception ('RangeIndex' object has no attribute 'step')
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h1>Summary</denchmark-h>
After invoking streamlit hello, and selecting "plotting demo" it failed with an exception: StreamlitAPIException: 'RangeIndex' object has no attribute 'step' <denchmark-h:h1>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
Invoke streamlit hello Choose a demo "Plotting demo" It failed with exception.
<denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior:</denchmark-h>
It should work without any exception and show the plotting demo. <denchmark-h:h2>Actual behavior:</denchmark-h>
It shows "StreamlitAPIException: 'RangeIndex' object has no attribute 'step'" <denchmark-h:h2>Is this a regression?</denchmark-h>
Not sure, but looks like a regression. <denchmark-h:h1>Debug info</denchmark-h>
Streamlit version: Streamlit, version 0.71.0 Python version: Python 3.7.7 Using Conda OS version: macOS Mojave 10.14.5 Browser version: Google Chrome Version 86.0.4240.198 (Official Build) (x86_64)

comments.comment: Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/sahajre>@sahajre</denchmark-link> -- this sounds potentially like the version of pandas you have is not one that streamlit supports. We have our pandas version carefully pinned in Pipenv, and sometimes other virtual environments don't respect this requirement and pull in the wrong pandas version. If you can, would you give me the output of the following command? pip freeze | grep pandas Also, <denchmark-link:https://discuss.streamlit.io/t/error-while-running-plotting-demo/2655/11>see this thread on the forum regarding potentially the same problem and how they solved it.</denchmark-link> Sorry you're having trouble!
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/nthmost>@nthmost</denchmark-link> : pandas version details <denchmark-code>$ pip freeze | grep pandas pandas==0.24.2 pandas-compat==0.1.1 </denchmark-code>

Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/nthmost>@nthmost</denchmark-link> , after updating version to 1.1.3, demos are working fine now. Steps I took (I'm using conda): <denchmark-code>$ conda update pandas $ pip list --format=freeze | grep pandas pandas==1.1.3 pandas-compat==0.1.1 </denchmark-code>
